dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This Calculate Stream Order tool is used to attribute the line network by Strahler stream order. The output is a polyline feature class that is dissolved by sections between stream confluences.

More detailed documentation is available here.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Kelly Whitehead and Jesse Langdon, South Fork Research, Inc.

tool.name: StreamOrderTool

param.name: InputStreamNetwork
param.dialogReference:
The stream network polyline feature class used to generate stream order.

Requirements Include:

* Projected coordinate system, not geographic.* All appropriate polylines are connected as a network.* All braids removed.* File geodatabase polyline feature class* Z and M geometry disable for the Shape field.

param.name: DownstreamReach
param.dialogReference: `ObjectID` value of the downstream outlet reach.

param.name: outputStreamOrderFC
param.dialogReference: File name and directory location (in a file geodatabase) of the output polyline feature class that will include the stream order as an attribute.

param.name: outputJunctionPointsFC
param.dialogReference: File name and directory location (in a file geodatabase) of the output point feature class which includes locations of stream order transitions (used for splitting tributaries, see post processing step).

param.name: InputTempWorkspace
param.dialogReference: File geodatabase or folder to store temporary processing files. If a workspace is not designated, the tool will use the "in_memory" workspace. The temporary files will not be available for review, but the processing speed will be greatly improved.

tool.summary:
This Calculate Stream Order tool is used to attribute the line network by Strahler stream order. The output is a polyline feature class that is dissolved by sections between stream confluences.

More detailed documentation is available here.
